intro: Euploca lobbii, commonly known as the New Zealand native plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in coastal and wetland habitats. The plant features slender, upright stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white flowers appear in umbels, which are characteristic of the carrot family. Euploca lobbii is known for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations and stabilizing coastal soils.
